title: Appeal a 14-Day Suspension
body: I was just placed on a 14-Day suspension because a duo of people flamed me and called me a dirty %%%%%% and said that they didn't want to play with me because i was black. They reported me and i received a 14 day suspension when i didn't say anything rude to them. Is there a way i can appeal this because the decision was reached in error.

replies.body:
> I was just placed on a 14-Day suspension because a duo of people flamed me and called me a dirty %%%%%% and said that they didn't want to play with me because i was black. 

There is no possible scenario in which this would penalize you. You cannot be penalized for what other people say/do.

You are responsible for your own words and actions. Riot Games has a zero-tolerance policy towards hate speech. Whoever types it is responsible.

Riot Tantram I understand your sentiment. However, these individuals completely dehumanized me. I believe your system may have picked up that I typed the word "%%%%%%" because after they said what they did to me and intentionally fed in the game, I played in a way to enable our jungle to carry and thats win the game, I said that I played that way because they called me a "dirty %%%%%%". I said nothing derogatory to those summoners. And as a black male I'm surprised you can reply so coldly to a cry for help from a community where racism is a huge problem.

You opt-ed into a Discord experience, and were the one to bleed the negativity from there into the game. 

Each person is responsible for their own behavior. If people in-game are harassing you or using hate speech, report them after game. There however is nothing we can do about what is happening in a Discord chat you opted into.

> And as a black male I'm surprised you can reply so coldly to a cry for help from a community where racism is a huge problem.

I think this illustrates how seriously we take racism in League of Legends.

If you wish to dispute your penalty, opening a ticket with Player Support is the proper course of action.

Furthermore, I'm sure you've heard this in school and elsewhere, but *bullies have no power over you unless you give them power over you.* Actively railing against them and lashing back at them and feeling indignant and hurt and angry gives them power over you. Sure!  It takes more than one report for a punishment to be issued.  Players have to reach a "punishment threshold" before the system determines that they have been negative enough to warrant a punishment.  Even in the case of hate-speech, if a player has played hundreds of games, and never been reported before, but receives a single report for hate speech in a game where they use a slur one time, they may not be issued a ban.  And out of all the toxicity categories, hate speech is usually considered to be the worst.  The lesser-evil categories tend to take more reports before a player will reach the point where the system decides that it is time to issue a punishment.  

I'm sure you've seen some of us talk in other threads about how a player can work themselves back into "good standing" by playing games without being reported.  This sort of thing probably also comes into play prior to a punishment being issued.  With some cases, it is not so much that a player received X number of reports, but X percentage of reports.  Players that are consistently negative will be punished, while players that are not consistently negative are much less likely to be punished.  So, if you happen to report someone who is a consistently positive player, then no, your single report won't get them banned. 

And if you are reporting copious amounts of people for the things that you listed, then you really are diluting the importance of your reports to the system.  Swear words by themselves are not prohibited, it's only when they are directed at other players in derogatory manners that they begin to violate the rules.  As far as saying "ez" or asking for a report, you need to use a judgment call.  If a player says it one time, but does or says nothing else in the entire rest of the game that is out of line, you run the risk of having your report tossed out.  Is it considered poor sportsmanship to say "ez?" Yes.  Is it considered harassment to call for reports?  Yes.  Is the IFS going to issue a punishment for someone saying it one time?  Most likely not.   99% not.  So when you flood the system with reports like that, you can make yourself look unreliable to the system.  In those cases, it may be better to let the players who say it one time, but have otherwise been a pleasant teammate/opponent slide, so that when someone comes along who is genuinely toxic, your report is taken seriously.
